channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Rules Ultra-Orthodox Jews Must Be Drafted Into Military
item.description: The court ruled there was no basis to exempt the ultra-Orthodox from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government amid the war in Gaza.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Half a Million in Gaza Face Starvation, Report Says
item.description: A U.N.-backed panel of experts said Israel’s war in Gaza had created a catastrophic lack of food, but stopped short of declaring a famine in the territory.

item.title: Warren Buffet-backed BYD’s ultra-affordable EVs are struggling in one market: Japan
item.description: BYD’s sales have been lukewarm since entering the Japanese passenger vehicle market, where it faces a rebound in the popularity of hybrids and loyalty to domestic brands like Toyota.

item.title: Assange Agrees to Plea Deal, and Israel-Lebanon Border Strikes Intensify
Israel’s Supreme Court Rules Ultra-Orthodox Jews Must Be Drafted Into Military
item.description: The court ruled there was no basis to exempt the ultra-Orthodox from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government amid the war in Gaza.

item.title: Top investor dubs U.K. a ‘banana economy’ with a ‘build absolutely nothing anywhere near anything’ mantra
item.description: PIC says the U.K.'s stunted planning policy is leaving $250 billion for viable projects unused.

item.title: Kenya Tax Protests Are Driven by Young People
item.description: The movement augurs trouble for President William Ruto, who campaigned on helping the poor. Activists and lawyers said several prominent critics of the finance bill had been abducted.

item.title: Fire Exposes Harsh Work Conditions Migrants Face in South Korea
item.description: Foreigners do dirty, hazardous work, and advocates say the blaze that killed 22 at a battery plant shows that they need better protection.

item.title: Netflix wants managers to ask themselves whether they would rehire their current employees—and fire them, if the answer is ‘no’
item.description: "We encourage everyone to speak to their managers about what’s going well and what’s not on a regular basis. This helps avoid surprises."

item.title: Today’s Teenagers Have Invented a Language That Captures the World Perfectly
item.description: Our kids’ lingo is not only better than any we used, it’s a useful window into the way they see the world.

item.title: Kenya Tax Protests Are Driven by Young People
item.description: The movement augurs trouble for President William Ruto, who campaigned on helping the poor. Activists and lawyers said several prominent critics of the finance bill had been abducted.

item.title: The U.K.’s wine business is booming, so much so that Britain’s largest winemaker is considering putting itself up for sale to fund expansion
item.description: Founded 22 years ago, Chapel Down has witnessed the U.K.’s wine business boom as climate change wreaked havoc on other traditional wine-producing hubs.

item.title: How Venezuela’s Leader Could Stay in Power No Matter What Voters Want
item.description: Four former officials in the government of President Nicolás Maduro describe his options between now and an election that could remove him from power — or solidify his grip.

item.title: Emperor Naruhito to Visit London’s Kew Gardens, Which Has Links to Japan
item.description: Emperor Naruhito and his wife, Empress Masako, are touring the famous botanic gardens this week as part of a state visit to Britain.

item.title: Hip-hop star Megan Thee Stallion is promoting Amazon’s 10th annual Prime Day with a new original song called—surprise—‘It’s Prime Day’
item.description: On Tuesday, the rapper unveiled a new original song called “It’s Prime Day.” An accompanying music video shows her purchasing a pink dog collar, fake eyelashes and other items from Amazon.
